aphorism: "I don't want to hear about your problems, I'm only here for the good times!"
author: A friend who tired of being someone's soundboard

aphorism: Feeling desired is more important than fucking.
author: Alfonso

aphorism: Learn from your parents mistakes - use birth control!
author: Anya Portnik

aphorism: Happiness is mostly a by-product of doing what makes us feel fulfilled.
author: Benjamin Spock

aphorism: Can't is the cancer of 'happen'.
author: Charlie Sheen

aphorism: When a man is happy, the meaning of life and other themes of eternity rarely interest him.
author: Dr. Snaut

aphorism: Beginning something is the same for everybody, everywhere, whether you start at 20 years old or at 40.
author: Eric Cantona

aphorism: You can change your mind but you can't change your destiny.
author: Fat Freddy's Drop

aphorism: Don't piss down my back and tell me it's raining.
author: Fletcher

aphorism: Carpe diem, quam minimum credula postero ("Seize the Day, putting as little trust as possible in the future")
author: Horace

aphorism: Any artist who claims to not care what other people think of their work is either lying, or making really bad art.
author: Jay Denes

aphorism: "Nobody is ever on their death-bed, dying, saying 'I wish I could have worked more and spent more time in the office!'"
author: John O'Donnell

aphorism: There is a form of loneliness perhaps worse than any other, the loneliness of being in the wrong relationship.
author: Jonathan Weiler

aphorism: People spend more on things that they want than things that they need.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

aphorism: Painting is the most beautiful of lies.
author: Kees van Dongen

aphorism: "If you know what you are doing you don't need to look like you know what you are doing,"
author: Larry Mann

aphorism: You won the lottery. So why throw away the ticket in order to play again?
author: Lil Louis

aphorism: "Why must you tell me all your secrets when it's hard enough to love you knowing nothing?
author: Lloyd Cole and the Commotions

aphorism: In our fantasies we think some guy is going to see us for how special we are when most of us are pretty ordinary
author: Lori Gottlieb

aphorism: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder when you are coming home at night.
author: Margaret Mead

aphorism: There's two things that smell like fish. One is fish.
author: Overheard in a pub

aphorism: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

aphorism: I am always doing things I can't do, that's how I get to do them.
author: Pablo Picasso

aphorism: If you want to be happy, don't look at other people.
author: Raj Kumar Bungay

aphorism: You gave your life to become the person you are right now. Was it worth it?
author: Richard Bach

aphorism: I paid her so she wouldn't have to be a prositute.
author: Silvo Berlusconi

aphorism: If told "Never mind the theory-we want something practical!" Respond "Mind the theory and you will get something practical."
author: Unknown

aphorism: The important thing is to not stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

aphorism: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

aphorism: The only difference between me and a madman is that I'm not mad.
author: Salvador Dali

aphorism: To learn who rules over you, simply find out who you are not allowed to criticize.
author: Voltaire
